alert.note: Alert for Heard; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Heard and northern Troup Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Wares Crossroads, or 8 miles northwest of LaGrange, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... LaGrange, Franklin, Hillcrest, Wares Crossroads and Harrisonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
